content.title: Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS
content.description: Risks and management considerations for pregnancy in women with vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

key_concepts.details: Historical maternal mortality quoted at 12-25%; may be lower with modern management and surveillance
Risk of uterine rupture, arterial rupture (especially iliac), and postpartum hemorrhage
Highest risk in third trimester and peripartum period
Consider cesarean delivery, high-risk obstetric care, cardiovascular monitoring

content.clinical_significance: Preconception counseling essential for women with vEDS
